questions.text: If x + y = 10 and x - y = 4, what is the value of x?
What is the main idea of the passage?

options.text: The author describes a personal experience with nature that led to a profound realization
The text explores scientific concepts related to environmental conservation
The passage presents historical events that shaped modern ecology
The narrative discusses cultural trends in environmental awareness

questions.passage: As I wandered through the ancient forest that morning, the mist still clinging to the moss-covered trees, I felt a sense of connection I had never experienced before. The silence was profound, broken only by occasional birdsong and the soft crunch of leaves beneath my feet. It was in this moment of solitude that I began to understand our place in the natural world—not as conquerors or even caretakers, but as participants in something far greater than ourselves. The forest didn't need me, yet it welcomed my presence, indifferent yet inclusive. This paradox struck me as the very essence of our relationship with the natural world.

questions.text: Which choice best describes the structure of the passage?

options.text: A chronological account of events followed by a reflection
A comparison of past and present circumstances
A statement of a problem followed by possible solutions
A personal anecdote that illustrates a scientific principle

questions.text: Recent data from the Bureau of Labor Statistics indicate that the unemployment rate for high school graduates who do not attend college is significantly higher than for those with bachelor's degrees. However, certain vocational fields show employment rates comparable to those of college graduates, suggesting that _______.

options.text: all high school students should pursue a college education
college degrees are becoming less valuable in the job market
vocational training may be a viable alternative to a four-year degree for some students
employment rates are not a reliable indicator of economic success

questions.text: The author's tone in the passage can best be described as

options.text: critical and dismissive
nostalgic and reflective
enthusiastic and optimistic
objective and analytical

questions.text: If 3x - 5 = 16, what is the value of x?
The function f(x) = 2x² - 4x + 3 has its minimum value at x = a. What is the value of a?
A circle has a circumference of 12π inches. What is the area of the circle in square inches?
In triangle ABC, the measure of angle B is 45° and the measure of angle C is 60°. What is the measure of angle A?
If f(x) = 3x - 2 and g(x) = x² + 1, what is the value of f(g(2))?
